result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael John Kreisle

records.addlTxt:
Letter from defendant.  
(note from Comm. Koppa attached)

Order Modifying Bond.
It is hereby ordered, based on statements made on the record, that the defendant's bond is modified to allow contact between Mr. Kreisle and Stephanie Neuser.  The contact shall be limited to matters unrelated to this pending felony matter.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:07 AM - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael John Kreisle appeared by video, in custody, at Outagamie County Jail.  Attorney Ann M. Larson appeared by video for Michael John Kreisle. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
MOTION TO MODIFY CONDITION OF BAIL-
Attorney Larson asks that the no contact condition with Stephanie Neuser be lifted.  Attorney Feest objects.
The Court will remove the condition of no contact with Stephanie Neuser.  However, the Court adds the condition that the defendant and Ms. Neuser have no discussions about case no: 22 CF 259 and 22 CF 293 and that contact will continue to be prohibited until the bail condition on Ms. Neuser's case be modified, if and when that happens.  The defendant states he understands this.  
Attorney Larson to draft the necessary order.
Further proceedings scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Further proceedings on August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely.
Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion to modify the bond to allow contact with Stephanie Neuser.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely.

10:28 a.m.  Defendant does not appear today; was moved to Outagamie County Jail per defense counsel.
Good cause found to toll time limits.  Preliminary hearing rescheduled to 5/26/22, 11:00 a.m., Br. 3.
Minutes

Preliminary hearing on May 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:16 a.m.  Defendant in custody.  Public Defender unable to find counsel to represent defendant. Good cause found to toll time limits.
Preliminary hearing rescheduled to 5/12/22, 10:30 a.m., Br. 3.
Minutes
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.
AMENDED Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
10:40 AM Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael John Kreisle appeared by video, in custody. 
Defendant requests bail be modified, his father is ill and he wants to be able to support and take care of him as needed.  He would live with his mother in Appleton and work at Menards.
State objects to bail modification.
Court modifies bail to $1,000 cash, with any previously ordered conditions to continue.  Amended commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.

10:40 AM Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael John Kreisle appeared by video, in custody. 
Public defender needs more time to appoint counsel.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Court tolls time limits.  
Preliminary hearing reset to 04-28-2022 at 11:00am
Preliminary hearing on April 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:58 a.m.  Defendant in custody.  Public Defender unable to find counsel to represent defendant.  Good cause found to toll time limits.
Preliminary hearing rescheduled to 4/21/22, 10:30 a.m., Br. 3.

Preliminary hearing on April 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Letter addressed to the Judge and Public Defender regarding the case - no indication of who the letter is from and is unsigned.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 04-07-22 at 10:30 a.m.   
Minutes.
Preliminary hearing on April 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Victim Identification Key.
Re:  Child Neglect, repeater, on 03-22-22.
Order to report to TRPD for photo and prints
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of child neglect.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 03-28-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 cash bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with Stephanie Neuser and no contact with children S.N., DOB: 07-30-18; K.N., DOB: 08-11-14; and A.D., DOB: 09-02-10 unless approved by Manitowoc CPS.    Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
